metadata.title: CVE-2014-3708 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
OpenStack Compute (Nova) before 2014.1.4 and 2014.2.x before 2014.2.1allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (CPUconsumption) via an IP filter in a list active servers API request.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3708` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nova-ajax-console-proxy - 1:2014.1.4-0ubuntu1
nova-api - 1:2014.1.4-0ubuntu1
nova-api-ec2 - 1:2014.1.4-0ubuntu1
nova-api-metadata - 1:2014.1.4-0ubuntu1
nova-api-os-compute - 1:2014.1.4-0ubuntu1
nova-api-os-volume - 1:2014.1.4-0ubuntu1
nova-baremetal - 1:2014.1.4-0ubuntu1
nova-cells - 1:2014.1.4-0ubuntu1
nova-cert - 1:2014.1.4-0ubuntu1
nova-common - 1:2014.1.4-0ubuntu1
nova-compute - 1:2014.1.4-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-kvm - 1:2014.1.4-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-lxc - 1:2014.1.4-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-qemu - 1:2014.1.4-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-uml - 1:2014.1.4-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-xcp - 1:2014.1.4-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-xen - 1:2014.1.4-0ubuntu1
nova-conductor - 1:2014.1.4-0ubuntu1
nova-console - 1:2014.1.4-0ubuntu1
nova-consoleauth - 1:2014.1.4-0ubuntu1
nova-network - 1:2014.1.4-0ubuntu1
nova-novncproxy - 1:2014.1.4-0ubuntu1
nova-objectstore - 1:2014.1.4-0ubuntu1
nova-scheduler - 1:2014.1.4-0ubuntu1
nova-spiceproxy - 1:2014.1.4-0ubuntu1
nova-volume - 1:2014.1.4-0ubuntu1
nova-xcp-network - 1:2014.1.4-0ubuntu1
nova-xcp-plugins - 1:2014.1.4-0ubuntu1
nova-xvpvncproxy - 1:2014.1.4-0ubuntu1
python-nova - 1:2014.1.4-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nova package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2014.1.4-0ubuntu1').
